38630170.review:
-Sinopsis 
Obscure es un juego de survival horror ambientado en un instituto americano donde podrás controlar a 5 adolescentes, que tendrán que descubrir el porqué de la desaparación de uno de ellos.
-Historia y ambientación.
Está lejos de ser el mejor argumento que te puedes encontrar en un videojuego de este estilo, es simple pero entretiene.
Tampoco tiene ningún misterio, ya que el juego apenas tiene mapeado y es muy simple. Además se te marcan los objetivos en el mapa, lo que hace que se vuelva todo más sencillo. 
Además cada personaje tiene una habilidad especial, uno comprueba si quedan o no más cosas en la habitación, otro abre cerraduras... . Este aspecto no está tan mal, aunque al final acabas usando estos dos, ya que son los que más cunden. Si te matan a un personaje, o bien le dejas morir o bien cargas la partida, a tu elección, ya que el juego tiene 2 finales, 1 con todos vivos y otro con alguno de ellos muerto.
La ambientación está conseguida en el sentido de que se va tornando más oscuro a medida que juegas, no porque los escenarios sean tétricos o bien conseguidos.
-Jugabilidad
Deja bastante que desear, y voy a suponer que lo vas a jugar con un amigo, ya que la inteligencia artificial en este obscure no esta muy desarrollada y tus compañeros derrochan balas. El juego te permite jugar con un mando para uno de los jugadores, siendo que el otro tendrá que jugar desde el teclado, y hasta que te acostumbres el juego es un poco infame. Las cámaras te van a jugar malas pasadas bastantes veces y se puede volver incómodo.
Lo único bueno de este apartado es que tienen autoapuntado, lo cual si lo juegas desde el teclado créeme, lo vas a agradecer.
-Gráficos
Para ser de la época del 2004 no es de lo mejor..., no es que sean muy necesarios, pero sí se nota que los escenarios son planos.
-Duración
En torno a unas 7 u 8 horas, es rejugable ya que una vez te lo pasas se desbloquean ciertos extras.
-OST
Es francamente muy buena, lo que más recomiendo del juego, crea tensión y es francamene buena.
-Valoración
Obscure no es del todo un mal juego, la historia es aceptable y te puede dar unas pocas horas de entrenimiento sobre todo jugando en cooperativo, pero no lo recomiendo. Eso sí, si estás pensando en hacerte con este o con el Obscure II, no te quepa duda de que es mejor el 1. 

4/10

36683130.review:
Сюжет [b]ObsCure[/b] повествует о старшей школе Лифмор – элитном учебном заведении, которое, по всем канонам жанра, окутано тайнами и загадочными происшествиями. Дело в том, что за всю историю существования школы, в ней пропал не один десяток студентов, но до этого никому не было дела, пока к числу пропавших не присоединился один из ключевых персонажей игры – Кенни. Его друзья и по совместительству наши подопечные, решают, во что бы то ни стало разыскать Кенни, поэтому разворачивают собственную поисковую кампанию в лучших традициях «Mystery Inc.». Но вселенная [b]ObsCure[/b] – это далеко не ванильно-пряничный мир «Скуби-Ду», хочется отметить, что [b]ObsCure[/b] является не просто хорошей игрой, но и достойным представителем таких жанров, как survival horror (в плане геймплея) и teenage horror (в плане сюжета). Тем не менее, незавершенность некоторых аспектов игры (например, повторяющиеся боссы) все же бросается в глаза. Возможно, сказался недостаток финансирования или же давление со стороны издателя, которому важно выпустить игру уже вчера.
[u]Рейтинг игры[/u] :

[b]Реиграбельность — нет[/b]

[b]Классный сюжет — да[/b]

[b]Оригинальность — нет[/b]

[b]Легко освоить — да[/b]

[b]Оправданность ожиданий: 60%[/b]

[b]Геймплей: 7.0[/b]

[b]Графика: 6.0[/b]

[b]Звук и музыка: 8.0[/b]

[b]Интерфейс и управление: 5.0[/b]

[u]Моё мнение о игре[/u] :

Музыка 10/10, Интерфейс и управление 10/10 (играл на Геймпаде), Оправданность ожиданий: 99% (ибо зная о второй части данного шедевра не понимаю почему всех не перенесли), [b]КОРОЧЕ ИГРА СТОИТ СВОИХ ДЕНЕГ !!![/b]

36059525.review:
You know, I'm really surprised that such a game is not selling with a discount for the Halloween sale on Steam. It fits in there just fine - but, due to some very illogical proprietor's behavior - it's rarely gets a discount at all. At least, they finally managed to make bundle of the first game and the sequel. If you're a games collector, you'll understand me there.
Well, what's that all about, anyway? Why would you wanted to buy this really dated wanna-be-Silent-Hill project?

Because it's a good one. If you don't mind a bit outworn graphics and gameplay from Resident Evil 2&3, with the addition of active using of flashlights, like in the Alone in the Dark or Alan Wake... With the system of optional coop game (only from one cosole/PC station, but yeah, real coop experience). With the story about dark scientific experiments on students of Leafmore high school, which plays like the well known "Faculty" horror movie... With the very original, yet unfairly cut (due to usual "rights" bullthing) soundtrack - I suggest to look for it in the web, it's really atmospheric.

For a game this old, with the console origin and UI, it felt surprisingly well and comfy to play now, in the late 2017. Well, at least for me. My personal rating? Like 78/100. Not very lengthy, but well-thought-through game I really enjoy to have in collection. Too bad, the sequel was not that good, and all next games in the line were cancelled...

It's really tough to write anything scathing or to pay grand compliments to this game. It's good, but not great; it's nothing special, but not bad. It's not scary in the least, but I think it was by design i.e. making it like a teen monster flick, so it's more body horror. 

The decent soundtrack and coop capability are the elements that stand above all else. Playing solo is ok, but playing with a buddy can be a lot more entertaining. If anything I recommend inviting a friend. The game is rather short, even for survival horror standards (~4 to 5 hours) so you can both finish it in one sitting.

<edit>

I would like to mention that playing with a gamepad is highly recommended.

</edit>

35640735.review:
В Obscure можно встретить множество элементов из других хоррор игр, которые вышли до и после нее. Это такие игры как:
[olist]
[*]Resident Evil и Silent Hill - статичная камера, механика прицеливания во врагов, атаки оружием ближнего боя, одновременно 2 играбельных персонажа.

[*]Alone in the Dark и Alan Wake – фонарик помогает в битве с монстрами.

[*]Until Dawn – концовка игры, зависящая от количества выживших главных персонажей.
[/olist]

[h1]Сюжет взял от всех понемножку.[/h1]

Сюжет взял всего понемножку от других подобных игр и фильмов. Но это не делает его плохим. Развивается он постепенно и дает ответы на все вопросы о происходящих событиях в старшей школе Лифмор.

[h1]Герои старшей школы.[/h1]

В распоряжении у игрока пять играбельных персонажей, у каждого из которых есть свой особый навык. Но игра спокойно проходится за любого понравившегося вам персонажа, несмотря на его навык. Одним героем управляете вы, а вторым ваш напарник или бот. А можно вообще почти всю игру бегать одному, оставив всех отдыхать.  Один из героев это прямо вылитый американский киноактер Джош Хартнетт.

[h1]Внешний вид обманчив?[/h1]

На каждого героя есть небольшое досье, из которого мы лучше узнаем их. Вот только образ Шеннон (очень короткая юбка, мелькающие труселя и некоторые ее фразочки) совсем не вяжется с тем, что в досье она указана как отличница и лучшая ученица класса.

[h1]Боты.[/h1]

Боты ведут себя вполне достойно, но иногда тупят и смотрят, как вас жрет или долбит свои языком очередной монстряка. Ботам можно отдавать 4 простые команды (стой здесь, двигай за мной и тд.) и меняться с ними оружием.

[h1]Оружие и местные обитатели.[/h1]

В игре есть оружие ближнего боя, огнестрельное и специальное. В общем-то это разные дубинки, которые не ломаются, пистолеты, дробовики, гранатка и лазерная пушка. Немного, но вам хватит, так как и видов врагов в игре немного. Но возникает один вопрос: "Как школьцы так хорошо обращаются с огнестрельным оружием? Они что проходят курсы профессиональной стрельбы?!"

Босс в игре один, и то последний. Жирная тварь же слишком легкая, чтобы считаться боссом.

[h1]Механика боя.[/h1]

Механика боя удобная, в игре есть автоприцеливание. Смена цели выполняется нажатием отдельной кнопки. Можно ходить, жечь врагов фонариком и стрелять. Фонарик действительно помогает при битве с врагами, ибо они боятся света. А в некоторых помещениях вообще можно ломать окна, чтобы победить врагов естественным светом.

[h1]Другие особенности геймплея.[/h1]
[list]
[*]3 уровня сложности на выбор, однако хард изначально закрыт. На харде мы находим меньше патронов, лечилок и дисков для записи, однако проблем с этим у вас не будет, если вы уже хотя бы раз прошли эту игру.

[*]Видел много жалоб на управление в этой игре, однако оно вполне себе удобное, если играть на геймпаде.

[*]В игре есть коопчик, но к сожалению только с 1 ПК.

[*]2 основных концовки, которые различаются между собой только количеством выживших играбельных персонажей.

[*]Игра линейна, всегда понятно куда идти и все места отмечаются на карте. Загадок в игре нет, есть пара легких головоломок.

[*]Сохраняться можно в любой момент игры, но вам нужно будет находить CD-диски, чтобы сделать запись.

[*]В игре есть быстрый телепорт в безопасную зону – точку сбора, где вы всегда сможете сменить персонажей.

[*]Далеко не все предметы, которые можно подобрать, хорошо подсвечиваются.
[/list]

[h1]А это что еще за "фрукт"?[/h1]

После прохождения игры на нормальной сложности открывается специальный режим, в котором есть два дополнительных оружия и другие одежки на персонажей. В этом режиме также можно выбрать любой уровень сложности.  Однако новой одеждой мы можем насладиться только в этом специальном режиме и не можем в нем же выбрать старые скины. А в простом режиме, наоборот, мы не можем взять новую одежду. Очень странный ход разработчиков по такому распределению одежды. Да и новые скины (по 1 на каждого персонажа) не сильно отличаются от стандартных, больше всего различий между одежками Шеннон. И еще альтернативные скины не отображаются в некоторых видеороликах.

[h1]Странности в Делюкс контенте.[/h1]

В корне игры есть папка “Deluxe Content”, в которой, помимо всего прочего, зачем-то есть папка со скриншотами из игры. Но зачем они мне, если я сам могу их сделать?!

[h1]Технические особенности.[/h1]

Игра не запускается на весь экран. Есть конечно мод для широких экранов, вот только он работает не для всех разрешений рабочего стола. Из игры вырезана музыка Sum 41, но вы можете ее запихнуть обратно, найдя в сети.

[b]Моя оценка[/b] этой игре [b]6[/b] опасных старшеклассников из [b]10[/b].

34940806.review:
Absolutely love this game! 

In the more recent years it seems as though games have lost touch with what they should be....enjoyable. Games have went to focusing on the video quality but not the quality of the game itself. What made games like Resident Evil and Silent Hill so great was the enjoyment they gave people when they first came out, they were challenging and creepy but, still managed to be enjoyable. Very few games can do that these days. Even Resident Evil and Silent Hill have diluted their own stories so much they might as well go ahead and name the games they come out with something else and just start over (don't get me wrong, RE7 was great and Silent Hills looked amazing but, they still didn't play or feel like their originals, the games that got them this far). 
This game captured all of it. It had the great enviroments, the amazing settings and atmosphere, the story was really well done, the game controls were clunky at times but not enough to really disrupt the game, (although I did plug in a controller to finish it). The cast of characters was enjoyable, the journey never felt tiresome or tedious, the puzzles were never so difficult that you had to look anything up online or rack your brain over for hours to figure out. You always knew what your path was and the game continued along smoothly the whole time. The camera angles were a little rough sometimes, but not to the point that it sets you up for failure.  I'm definately going to pick up Obscure 2 and play it once I finish doing everything I'm doing with this one. If you're worried about it being campy or corny....just remember the first Resident Evil's dialogue contained "Jill Sandwich" and look at how well it did. In my opinion, it's a great game and has quickly jumped up in my list of all time favorites and most enjoyable!

Loved this game when I was younger and it still holds it's own today (in certain ways). Graphics aren't great. Camera angles aren't great. Voice acting is REALLY not great. Gameplay isn't that great either (you need a control pad and will probably need to remap buttons). It's really not a very long game either, you'll be able to complete it within a few (2-3) hours if you know what you're doing... But the ambience is spot on and the game makes great use of light and music.

There are a lot of negatives about this game and specifically the port, but if you're a fan of a good survival horror game then don't let these put you off. Especially if it's on sale. For the pirce I paid, I feel that the game is worth it and I still really enjoyed playing it through agin, which is why I am recommending this game. Would definitely be interested in a remake/revamp of the title though!

34847685.review:
[h1]Замечательный аналог типичных американских ужастиков из 90х![/h1]

[b][i]Obscure[/i][/b] с самого дня своего релиза держится особняком от основного костяка [i]survival-horror[/i] игр, так полюбившихся народу ([b][i]Silent Hill, Resident Evil[/i][/b]). Она, как и многие другие игры, идущие по этому тернистому пути, почему-то незаметно для многих канула в лету. До сих пор задаюсь вопросом: "Что же пошло не так?". Была задумка, интересный концепт, который даёт волю фантазии и во многом развязывает руки разработчику, но увы, народное признание арифметическими формулами купить удаётся не всегда, да оно, быть может, и к лучшему!

Познакомиться с [b][i]Obscure[/i][/b] лично мне удалось ещё в школьные годы, когда я прикупил диск с этой игрой в одном из немногих магазинов моего города, в которых, в то время, вообще их продавали. Тут был весь спектр типичных "проблем" тех лет: без диска игра просто не запускалась и упорно требовала его, присутствовал вшитый [i]StarForce[/i], а также код на самом диске, который требовалось ввести при первом запуске. Все эти "трудности" в те годы всё же не смогли остановить мой неокрепший детский пытливый ум от предстоящего впереди приключения, чему я несказанно рад!

В этой игре вы получите всё, за что народ так любит жанр [i]survival-horror[/i]: пугающие и сильные враги, дефицит ресурсов, запутанный сюжет, головоломки и большие области для исследования. В свою очередь отличным дополнением станет то, что нам под управления дадут сразу несколько персонажей, что весьма необычно для данного направления игростроя!

Возвращаясь к началу нашего разговора стоит отметить, что со временем Вы поймете, почему же игре так и не удалось "прыгнуть выше головы" и сорвать зрительские симпатии. В ней есть всё, что необходимо, но оно не доведено до абсолютного уровня. Вам безусловно интересно проходить сюжет и двигаться вперёд, но [b][i]Obscure[/i][/b] при этом не пугает и не давит на психику так, как это делает [b][i]Silent Hill[/i][/b]. У нас имеется оружие и враги, мы можем защитить себя, но противники не столь разнообразны, как в [b][i]Resident Evil[/i][/b].

Я определённо порекомендую Вам [b][i]Obscure[/i][/b] для обязательного прохождение. Она, безусловно, не лучшая, но очень хороша! Всё же в наше время мало игр, который могут поистине считаться достойными представителями жанра [i]survival-horror[/i]! Не проходите мимо и изучите её от A до Я! [b][i]Obscure[/i][/b] определённо увлечет Вас не на один час!

Obscure is a unique underrated horror game. The story, it starts with Kenny who decides to stay late in the gem to shoot some hoops he then goes to pick up this cell and talk to his girlfriend.

As he does someone takes his gem bag. Kenny goes and tries to catch him, but winds up in a basement where he is locked up. Soon his sister and his friends go looking for him. But all is right with this school.

Now for the game itself. It’s got good gameplay some good scars, but that motley comes from the monsters and from some of the notes you get and some of the story too. 

You play as four then five people Josh, Stan, Shannon, Ashley, and latter Kenny. Who have all different abilities, like lock picking, healing more and ability to find useful stuff.

You can only play with two at a time, but you can pick witch ones at any time as long as you are near one of them to switch too. Or you can go it alone it’s up to you. 

The AI is okay, but sometimes when you need help they don’t help sometime. Plus when I was attacking that big blob monster with my laser gun and I ask them to wait they would run near it and get attacked.

There were some glitches in the game, but nothing game braking.All so there were no bosses but the find boss witch is sad, I like bosses in games. 

Then there was the fact you can only be healed by power drink or first add. I mean they could have added one more heal thing like drinking water. And the camera can take a little bit of getting used too.

But all in all this game is a very good old school horror game, and like I said in my review of Could Fear. I would like a remake of this game someday. 
So if you want a fun underrated old school Horror game this one is for you. 

But tell me what you guys and girls think.

34679206.review:
Starts out like a mix between Scream and The Facvulty - and actually stays that way :D
At the time of writing this the game is already 13 years old and I initially played it on PlayStation 2. So expect to see dated graphics AND a 4:3 aspect ratio. No widescreen, here. The game still runs on modern systems, though - so that's good. It's not one of these older games that you have to make work before actually being able to play. High resolutions are supported - the game is just scaled to the 4:3 aspect in the center. For a game from 2004 it still holds up very well, I think.

The controls are precise, no tank controls like the early Resident Evil games. The button layout is wonky and takes some learning. Then again if you've played any horror game from the era you will be able to pick it up quickly.
Saving uses items - no constant saving, unfortunately. But at least no stationary save points, either.

It's actually the only horror themed ResidentEvil style game I know of that lets two players play together with a teamplay mechanic. That's really cool.

Otherwise for everybody rebuying it for nostalgia: Be advised that the license for the two very cool and very fitting music tracs from Sum41 (Still waiting) and SPAN (Don't think the way they do) apparantly ran out. So the two are replaced by unfortunately rather bad generic tracks with a similar feel. Otherwise still recommended. Cheesy story, cliche teeny horror characters, stupid plot and not hiding that the game is aware of it, either.

Recommended.

34650763.review:
Not very scary, but definitely fun. ObsCure is a third person survival horror game with fixed cameras, a silly campy story set in a (American?) high school with voice acting so bad it's good.

Combat is well designed although it does take some time to get used to. There's a cast of five characters to choose from, each with a special perk. You control one plus one AI buddy tag along. The AI is okay. It won't slow you down, but it is very ammo conscious which is good but somtimes bad. For example there are enemies that can grab you and the only way to quickly recover is for the other character to shoot. Thankfully this isn't much of a problem because you can switch between both characters instantly. I like the use of environment to defend yourself. All the enemies are vulnerable to light, so for example if you walk into a room full of little zerglings, instead of wasting ammo you can break the windows and let the outside light kill them.

 Later in the game enemies become very strong, some with one hit kill moves (death is PERMANENT. Either continue on with that character dead or reload a save). You get better weapons along the way and enough ammo, healing items, and saves(same as ink ribbons from resident evil except you can save anywhere) to keep you decently stocked.

There aren't many puzzles in the game, and the puzzles are very easy. I don't mind because there's plenty of combat and as I said earlier the combat is good.

There isn't much to complain about. Some of the fixed camera angles are crap, where you have to shoot enemies off screen. There aren't many bosses and SPOILERS [spoiler] one boss you fight three times. Maybe it's just suppose to be a bullet sponge enemy, but it was disappointing to see it two more times after killing it once. [/spoiler] I did like the last boss though. Read the flavor text files, otherwise it will be very confusing.

The environment is well designed. The map isn't terribly big, but it organically opens up as you progress so back tracking isn't a chore. Near the end of the game I missed an important item, but it only took me maybe ten minutes to find it after combing through the school.

Obscure can be finished in one or two sessions, in about five to six hours. I recommend ObsCure. It's a quick, fun, silly game. I almost forgot to mention local multiplayer! If you have a buddy that will play with you, they control the second character. This makes the game so much more fun, but is still great single player.

(Terminé en Coop avec des amis - 100% Succès)

Vous avez déja vu le film "The Faculty" ? Vous êtes un fan des Teenages Horrors movies ?
Prenez un geek, un sportif, une bimbo et une intello sans oublier le rebel hacker, plongez les tous dans l'Obscurité de la nuit, enfermé en plein milieu de leur lycée et vous obtiendrez une magnifique histoire d'horreur ! 

Obscure réalise à la perfection se principe ! Entre un mélange des vieux résident evil et des vieux Alone in the dark, on retrouve ici le fammeux gameplay "de la caméra fixe". On évoluera avec notre équipe, chacun ayant une caractéristique permmettant de se rendre utile pour les autres mais aussi pour résoudre les nombreuses énigmes que Obscure recèle. Entre la survie et la gestion de son équipement, il faudrat colaborer avec son teammate. En effet, seulement une équipe de deux personnages est possible à la fois. Lui passer du soin, des balles ou encore le magnifique  fusil à pompe que vous venez de trouver sera peut être un choix judicieux, à vous de voir ! 

Et c'est la qu'est la force d'obscure. Car même si en SOLO l'IA de son teammate est bien programmé.
Le jeu dispose d'un mode COOP sur la même console. Et la force du titre est la, évolué sur le même écran avec un ami à coté de soi est bien plus fun ! 

Mention spécial : 
-> Pour la durée du titre : 6 heures de jeu (je le connaisais déja avant sur PS2) soit 7 heures si vous êtes néophite.  Et donc +-11h au total  pour la deuxième run en hardcore (débloqué après la première)  + mode spécial. 

-> La musique : les choeurs d'enfant de l'opéra de Paris sous la direction de Olivier Derivière sont justes énormes à écouter. A noté que les titres "Cinglés" de enhancer et "still waiting" de SUM41 ne sont plus présent dans le jeu suite à la fin du contrat du copyright. ainsi que les autres titres du groupe SPAN. dommage :(  

Je recommande Fortement ce jeu !

34210556.review:
Das "Until Dawn" für den PC!
Spoilerfrei!

STORY	
10/10 
"Vier Freunde sind für eine Nacht in ihrer Schule eingeschlossen und erleben dabei die längste Nacht ihres Lebens" So oder so ähnlich war der Werbespruch damals gewesen und ich wollte wissen, wie schlimm diese Nacht wohl werden würde. Meine Erwartungen waren also hoch. Und sie wurden vollstens erfüllt! An der Schule verschwinden immer wieder Schüler und als auch einer unserer Freunde als vermisst gilt, begeben sich die anderen vier, in der alten Schule, auf die Suche nach ihm...

LEVELDESIGN 
10/10 
Neben der Suche nach unserem Freund, steht natürlich auch die Frage im Raum, warum die Schüler verschwinden und was mit ihnen passiert. Um diese Frage zu beantworten, müssen wir in der ganzen Schule kleine Rätsel lösen und Antworten auf unsere Fragen finden. Dafür stehen uns vier der fünf Hauptpersonen zur Verfügung (den anderen Freund müssen wir ja suchen). Wir können uns nach belieben auswählen, welchen der vier wir spielen und welchen wir von den restlichen drei als Begleiter mitnehmen, denn jeder hat eine Spezialbegabung. Der eine kann schnell rennen, der andere Schlösser schneller knacken und der andere starke Nahkampfattacken ausführen etc. Um auf die Anfangsbemerkung "Until Dawn" einzugehen: Im Laufe des Spiels, können unsere Freunde durch kleine Fehler von uns sterben. So liegt es also in der eigenen Hand wer von unseren Freunden diese Nacht überleben wird. Hat man dann den Partner seiner Wahl festgelegt, beginnt man mit der Suche und erkundet so Schritt für Schritt das gesamte Schulgelände. Vom friedlichen Klassenzimmer bis in den feuchtnassen Keller. Die Level sind schön groß und mit vielen Details geschmückt. 

KI 
10/10 
Keine Mängel aufgefallen. Allerdings ist das Spiel auch schon über 10 Jahre alt, da kann man ein paar kleinere Fehler schon verzeihen.

GRAFIK 
10/10 
Wie eben angesprochen hat das Spiel schon ein paar Jahre auf dem Buckel, trotzdem fand ich sie jetzt nicht zu schlecht. 

SOUND 
10/10 
Hier ist wirklich alles dabei, von einer ruhigen Spieluhrmusik (Alma lässt grüßen) bis hin zu Chorgesang (wie im Film "Das Omen") ist alles dabei. Hier war ich echt überrascht, wieviel Mühe sich die Entwickler gegeben haben. 

Fazit: Das Spiel geht mit allem drum und dran ca. 4 Stunden, habe es also an einem Abend am Stück durchgespielt und war am Ende mehr als begeistert. Einziger Punkt den man erwähnen muss: Das Spiel wurde eigentlich für die Konsole entwickelt, deswegen spielt man ausschließlich mit der Tastatur (oder dem XBox Controller für den PC). Aber an die simple Steuerung gewöhnt man sich während des Prologs ganz schnell. Am Ende kann ich dieses Spiel allen empfehlen, die auf Spiele wie Alan Wake, Resident Evil und Death Space stehen. Der Preis ist meiner Meinung nach auch gerechtfertigt.


GESAMT
50/50

34111613.review:
Do you like old-school horror games? Do you like cheesy B movie slasher and monster films? Then, my friend, I introduce to you the obscure (pun intended) world of ObsCure.

It takes heavy influence from Video-Game titles such as Resident Evil and most notably Silent Hill. But then, as previously suggested, it also takes inspiration from horror films. The film it seems to take the most inspiration from, though, is a little 90's gem called 'The Faculty' starring none other than the legendary Elijah Wood. The characters in ObsCure are in many ways inspired by the characters from The Faculty much like the premise, scenario and location all seem very similar. In both the movie and the game it takes place on a school where something very dangerous and menacing is in a sense hidden within the school without anyone noticing.... seemingly everyone being oblivious other than a few cast of characters all with their own teen stereotype and differences. My favorite character of Stanley Jones (ObsCure) is for example heavily inspired by the character of Zeke Tyler (The Faculty.)

ObsCure is in my opinion the perfect game incarnation of a B movie horror flick. The quality of it all isn't the best, nor is the writing, graphics and more. But the game STILL holds up if you'd ask me. Ever now and then I see myself coming back to this game. I've beaten it around 2:30-40 hours as my quickest (yet as of writing this) playthrough. The hard difficulty does NOT play around (something I have not beaten as of writing this) and will test your skills "to the max" (enter cheesy 90's commercial here.)

While the game is relatively short I still do think it has a lot to offer in the sense that you'll always be on edge (especially as one of the many game mechanics is PERMA-DEATH if a character dies, which is the point where I personally always seem to reload my latest save.) It also introduces a back then unique "crafting system" as you could put a flashlight onto your shotguns with some ducttape. This makes the game both more interesting and also easier when you can combine a firearm and a flashlight (mind you there are different variations of flashlights, as all differ in power.) And this is key to survival as enemies CAN be killed through regular means but I would highly suggest you use their biggest weakness against them: Light sources.

As a little finisher to this review of the game I just have to tell whoever might read this that when I first discovered this game as a kid it was SUPER frightening and I literally couldn't get myself to play any further than a couple of minutes (if even that.) But then as I grew older and also grew to love horror I eventually revisited the game (last year, 2016, to be more specific) where I fell in love with this game! The character of Stan even got such a big impact on me that I've tried ever since then to somewhat mimic his hairstyle (it looks REALLY great with that sweet beanie of his!) and I also fell in love with the idea of having two layered shirts thanks to him. Lockpicking is actually also something I found myself surprisingly interested in due to none other than Stan here.

So you could definitley say that this game indeed has affected my life and personality to some extent. Also I've grown EXTREMELY fond of the intro/outro music for the Steam version. I cannot for the love of me find ANY information about that song ANYWHERE but started liking it so much I even made a cover in the music program Renoise quite awhile back of this specific song.


This was a pretty long, none structured review but I just HAD to write it all as I do indeed love this game for what it is. I've played through the sequel, ObsCure 2: The Aftermath several times and really like that game too (although the first one is thus far my favorite in the ObsCure franchise.) I even had fun playing through the reboot, Final Exam (although this game is by far the most repetitive and also lacks all the characters and spooks of the original two games so it's the worst in the franchise in my opinion. Still worth a playthrough though if you're into 2.5D side-scrolling beat-em-ups.)

Do you like Resident Evil, Silent Hill, slasher and monster films? Then buy this game or at the very least look up some Let's Plays on YouTube as it feels like a great tribute to all of these things while staying original to an extent. Happy gaming!

34071496.review:
Obscure looks and even plays similar to classic Resident Evil and Silent Hill, minus any real puzzle-solving - that much is evident.  The camera angles alone are a telltale sign of what's influenced this game. I was recommended playing this and until then I have never heard of it so I had no idea what to expect, but I was pleasantly surprised.  

Horror elements will take you back to the golden days of survival horror without a doubt.  The music and overall atmosphere sets a foreboding kind of tone that classic horror games delivered so well.  It reminds me of Resident Evil Outbreak except it's nowhere near that intense. Enemies can be difficult to take down unless you have enough firepower and they will jump out and catch you off guard numerous times. Controls are relatively simple to understand but there is a small learning curve especially because an important mechanic in Obscure is controlling different characters.  Some characters are better suited for certain tasks which might make one particular character more desirable in a situation over another. 

Leafmore High school is the setting and while that is extraordinarly cliche and cheesy, it works. The characters are a group of teenagers who are trying to figure out what went wrong with their school because very quickly into the game, they realize that shi* hit the fan.  This does sound like a B rated horror movie that went straight to DVD but it has charm and doesn't take itself too seriously.  I mean, look at Resident Evil 2, that didn't have the most unique story but it was fantastic despite its cheesy and over the top dialogue at times.

Overall, regarding gameplay and horror, you can expect a satisfying experience.  In the way of story, well, it's nothing really engrossing.  Playtime can last anywhere between 7-9 hours on a first playthrough.  It's pretty short but at no point did playing feel needlessly dragged out, and that's a good thing.

33449879.review:
[h1]Obscure Review[/h1]

Obscure is a survival horror game that follows five students caught up in a mystery surrounding their school. Disappearances of the students have become more salient over the years and it just so happens that this little gang of Scooby Doo wannabes is here to close this caper. Can you unravel the horrible secrets behind these closed doors?

[h1]Preface[/h1]

As far as survival horror goes, you're looking at a fairly predictable (almost carbon-copy) of the Resident Evil series. Sure, there are a few things scattered about the gameplay that make it different, but the same concepts apply. Search rooms, gather items, shoot monsters. One could argue that the only thing changed here is the setting, but I think most are willing to look past that.

Although I give this game a good rating, I believe that your enjoyment with Obscure will be heavily reliant on whether or not you played survival horror in the past. Honestly, I think the entertainment value hinges almost entirely on nostalgia trips, as this game is really nothing to look at nowadays. Still, some times it is nice to see where we came from and Obscure should certainly keep you occupied if you even have the slightest bit of curiosity about this gem.

With that being said, let's talk about a few things.

[h1]The Good[/h1]

Since you have the ability to choose from five different characters at any point throughout the game, you should know that each character has their own advantage. One can hit harder with melee weapons while another can pick locks faster. It adds a certain depth to the game that can really make you strategize your next moves.

To add onto this, all the characters are mortal. Unless every one of your characters die, you are never met with a game over screen. You simply go back to your next available character and start all over. Having the characters be able to die is really interesting to me, as it made me feel more connected with some of the characters. It makes every health pack important and every room a nightmare if you're low on health.

Another cool thing about controlling characters is that you can control your partner. While it doesn't have as much depth as controllable AI today, it is neat that you can tell your character to stay put while you scout ahead or have them follow and back you up. Again, just that extra layer of strategy that the game adds is very enjoyable, at least to me.

The dialogue is great too, but I can see why some people might not like it. If there were ever characters to personify the early 2000s, Obscure's characters would be it. A lot of the cutscenes are laughable and the character interaction is just as neat. At any rate, it is cool to see what was really in style years ago in comparison to how we are now with our games. 

Also, I have to say this. The soundtrack is damn-near phenomenal. People might be interested to know that the same person who made the soundtrack for the new horror game Get Even, Olivier Deriviere, is the same person who made the soundtrack for this game. Seriously, if you don't want to buy the game, just look this OST up on YouTube and please agree with me that it's fantastic.

Lastly, I think the gameplay is just all right. I had troubles putting the general gameplay in the positives or negatives because there are times where I was incredibly frustrated with it, but other times where I was pleasantly surprised. If you burn through ammunition and health packs, you'll probably get irritated quick. Otherwise, the gameplay is actually pretty engaging and fun.

[h1]The Bad[/h1]

Maps are pretty great in this game, but only last until you reach the end level. Without spoiling anything, the end map is seriously frustrating. Corridors, doors, and chambers all over the place that can leave you wondering where you're at spatially. I had a hard time navigating some of the rooms near the end because I kept entering the same place. So, traversing that area was a big pain in the rear and took me way longer than it should have.

The story is lackluster. Like I said in the preface, this game is really reliant on nostalgia. You won't be getting a grade-A story here. It's going to be very odd and almost laughably silly. I can't imagine that anyone finds the story to be good nowadays. Maybe back in 2005 when this was considered scary as all hell, but not today. If you buy Obscure for the story, you'll be disappointed.

Characters are disappointing. Their abilities are cool, don't get me wrong, but anything that allows you to feel empathetic about these people is void in Obscure. You have some very slightly interactions between them, but there's no personality to latch onto. They're just the typical High School cliches: the jock, the geek, the promiscuous, etc. It makes beating the game feel sort of lame, if I'm being honest. 

Also, just had to add this in. 

When you first start the game, you meet up with two of your friends in a classroom. The janitor comes by and locks everything up and your goal is to stay after school, sneak around, and find your missing buddy. What's the first thing you have to do? Pick up a bat and smash a window in, steal an item from said room, then pick the locks to escape. I mean, the school goes absolutely bonkers anyways, but come on.. That's grounds for expulsion, right there!

[h1]Overall[/h1]

Looking for a trip down memory lane at a fair price? Go ahead and buy this sucker. The story is mediocre, but it's at least entertaining enough to keep you playing. Gameplay is pretty decent and, while it doesn't stand up to Resident Evil or Silent Hill, it still earns its spot for die-hard fans of survival horror.

31645498.review:
Obscure

História

ObsCure se passa no colégio leafmore, que é dirigido pelo diretor Herbert Friedman. O colégio parece tranquilo, mas sempre ocorrem estranhos acontecimentos no mesmo, desaparecimentos, vozes, mensagens, etc.
Até que um dia, um aluno, Kenny Matthews, Decide ficar na quadra até um pouco mais tarde pra jogar basquete. Ele vai até o vestiário atender uma chamada em seu celular e não percebe que alguém, acaba roubando a sua mochila. Obviamente Kenny tenta procurar e acaba indo parar em uma mansão ''abandonada'' e acaba entrando no porão. em uma sala ele encontra um aluno desaparecido, Dan que se encontra em estado de pânico, careca ,pálido e uma aparência estranha. Kenny decide ajudar o Dan a fugir dali, mas surge então uma criatura assustadora que mata Dan antes de fugir, Kenny tenta fugir, mas alguém acaba fechando o alçapão do porão.

No dia seguinte, a irmã de Kenny(Shannon), dá pela falta de seu irmão que não chegou em casa. ela acreditava que ele estava com sua namorada(Ashley) mas descobriu que o mesmo estava desaparecido, então as duas se convencem que Kenny realmente desapareceu, e então vão falar com Josh sobre o sumiço. ele por sua vez, tem a certeza que Kenny desapareceu da escola, isso porque suas pesquisas para seu jornal da escola, descobriu que vários alunos acabaram por desaparecer no colégio. Josh então dá a ideia de ficarem no sábado em Leafmore para achar Kenny.

Josh vê isso como sua ''grande investigação''. Só que os três, Josh, Ashley e Shannon acabam por ficarem trancados dentro da escola e descobrem muitas coisas misteriosas sobre Leafmore, como monstros que só aparecem de noites, assassinatos, etc. Mais tarde encontram Stan em uma sala, tentando adulterar suas notas. para ver se consegue passar de ano, e ele se junta aos outros.

Personagens

Kenny Matthews: Kenny é considerado o protagonista do jogo. Nascido no dia 30 de junho de 84, Kenny é um esportista ágil e rápido, porém, meio irresponsável. 

Shannon Matthews: Irmã mais nova de Kenny, Shannon que é nascida no dia 23 de agosto de 86, é totalmente diferente do irmão, já que é responsável e compenetrada nos estudos. ela sempre tira as melhores notas do colégio, e é a ''cérebro'' do grupo, tanto que ajuda os amigos quando estão machucados graças a seus conhecimentos de medicina e luta. 

Josh Carter: Josh que é nascido no dia 29 de novembro de 85, é um jovem que sonha em ser repórter, e vive com sua inseparável câmera, filmando ou os jogos de basquete de Kenny, etc.
Josh que dá a ideia de seus amigos investigarem o sumiço de Kenny, uma vez que ele é um ótimo investigador. Parece também, ter uma queda por Shannon.

Stanley ''Stan'' Jones: Stan, é o típico ''aluno-problema'' da escola. Nascido em 20 de junho de 85, ele nunca tira boas notas, corre o risco de repetir pela terceira vez. ele se junta a Shannon e os outros aós ser flagrado tentando adulterar suas notas, e ajuda no resgate de Kenny, se mostra um grande amigo, tem a especialidade de abrir portas trancadas.

Ashley Thompson: Ashley é a namorada de Kenny, Nascida em 17 de janeiro de 85, é uma jovem inteligente e determinada, é uma lutadora nata. Sabe lidar perfeitamente com qualquer arma, o que é uma grande ajuda pra todos

Jogabilidade 

Obscure é um dos únicos jogos survivor-horror que podem ser jogados com multi-player. E é aqui que surgem uma das grandes inovações de Obscure, o modo para dois jogadores. Duas pessoas podem encarnar os dois personagens, e descobrir os mistérios em conjunto. A aventura fica mais divertida, a interação entre os dois jogadores é bem mais real e os combates ficam então mais emocionantes. Também existe a mecânica de perder o personagem após morrer com ele, caso você morra com algum personagem, obviamente você ira perder o mesmo e não vai poder mais jogar com ele oque dará em algum final alternativo no jogo, caso você morra com todos os 5 personagens é game-over.

Quando virem manchas pretas a cobrir paredes, do teto e solo, algo muito mal vem aí, preparem as lanternas/armas. não existem muitos monstros no jogo, a variedade é bem pequena só existem 5 a 6 monstros um boss e um mini-boss. as manchas pretas também podem cobrir os monstros, que caso isso aconteça você precisa apontar a lanterna nele pra diminuir sua defesa, assim facilitando o trabalho. 

Não existem muitas armas no jogo, pistolas, Tacos, Shotguns Flashbangs e algumas outras armas especiais que são liberadas de acordo com a dificuldade que você termina o jogo. você ao longo do jogo encontra lanternas, que com as fitas adesivas, você pode combinar com as armas, assim facilitando ainda mais pra derrotar os monstros com as manchas. Você também pode usar diversos itens para se curar, como latinhas de bebidas e kit médicos.

Trilha sonora.

Sua trilha sonora é composta pela música ''Still waiting'' do Sum 41, e Don't think the way they do'', da banda Span. durante o jogo você escuta gritos, ventos e alguns barulhos de desabamento, deixando assim o jogo ainda mais tenso.  

Gráficos.

Os gráficos dos jogos pra seu tempo não foram lá uma coisa, claro, não é por isso que o jogo se torna ruim, porém na minha opinião poderia ser um pouco melhor. 

Pontos importantes.

O Jogo não se encontra bugs, pelo menos até aonde eu vi.
Os loadings não são demorados, oque é ótimo.
Existem 2 finais, que muda de acordo com sua jogatina ou com a morte de algum personagem 
Algumas ações podem resultar na morte de algum personagem, então cuidado.
Quanto maior a dificuldade, menos itens e mais monstros vão aparecendo, dificultando ainda mais a jogatina.
A IA do jogo é algo podre. caso você jogue sozinho com bots, vai passar muita e muita raiva porque se o bot morrer com o personagem, você o perde. caso você não de armas pro seu bot aliado, ela vai se tornar mais inútil que a Ashley do Resident Evil 4.
Você pode se defender com varias armas, como falei lá acima, com lanternas, tacos  bombas e algumas outras armas, etc.

Recomendo.

31439269.review:
[h1][i]Overview[/i][/h1]
เกม [b]Survival Horror[/b] สมัย PS2 ภาคแรกของซีรีส์เกมชุดนี้ที่นำเสนอความหลอนของบรรยากาศภายในโรงเรียนหลังเลิกเรียน การหายตัวไปของนักเรียนในโรงเรียน,เพื่อนร่วมรุ่นรวมถึงเหตุการณ์แปลกประหลาดที่เกิดขึ้นกับตัวคุณ ความลับดำมืดบางอย่างที่ถูกซ่อนไว้ ที่คุณต้องพยายามหาคำตอบรวมทั้งเอาตัวรอดจากสถานการณ์อันเลวร้ายนี้

[h1][i]Story[/i][/h1]
- เนื้อเรื่องจะเซตไปที่การหายตัวไป Kenny แฟนหนุ่มของ Ashley ที่มัวแต่อยู่ซ้อมบาสเก็ตบอลจนมืด เธอถึงกับหัวเสียคิดว่าตัวเองโดนเทเพราะพลาดเดทกับเธอเมื่อคืน แต่ Kenny ไม่ได้กลับบ้านแถมยังไม่โผล่หน้ามาโรงเรียน ด้วยความเป็นห่วงเธอเลยปรึกษากับเพื่อนๆและความคิดบ้าๆของ Josh การสืบสวน(ตามหา Kenny)หลังเลิกเรียนก็ได้เริ่มขึ้น โดยที่พวกเค้าไม่รู้เลยว้าจะต้องหาทางเอาตัวรอดจากโรงเรียนแห่งนี้
- เนื้อเรื่องช่วงเริ่มต้นอาจจะดูไม่มีอะไรเท่าไหร่ แต่พอไปเรื่อยๆซักพักจะเริ่มตืนเต้นและชวนหลอน จะมีช่วงอืดๆนิดๆหน่อยแต่ความต่อเนื่องของเกมจะไม่ทำให้คุณเบื่อทีเดียว เนื้อเรื่องสไตล์หนังเกรด B เพราะงั้นถ้าใครคิดจะหาเนื้อเรื่องแบบล้ำๆอาจจะผิดหวังหน่อย แต่รับรองครับว่าสนุกแน่นอน
[h1][i]Gameplay[/i][/h1]
ระบบเกมเพลย์เข้าใจง่ายแต่อาจจะต้องใช้เวลาควบคุมและทำความเเข้าใจนิดหน่อย [b]การควบคุม[/b]หลายคนแนะนำให้ใช้จอยสติ๊กแต่สำหรับคนที่ไม่มีผมแนะนำว่าให้ config คีย์บอกบอร์ดตามที่เหมาะมือเลย(มีให้ไปอยู่ที่ตั้งค่าอ่ะนะ ตัวเกมอาจจะง่ายแต่จะเล่นยากเพราะปุ่มบางปุ่มนี่แหละ 555 ช่วงแรกๆของเกมจะเน้นประโยชน์จากสถานที่ เช่น ถ้าคุณเจอมอนฯเยอะๆในห้องให้คุณมองหากระจกและทุบมันจากนั้นแสงที่เป็นธีมหลักจะจัดการกับมอนฯเองทำให้พอเล่นง่ายในช่วงแรกๆแต่พอตกมืดเท่านั้นแหละ(อิอิ) ผมพูดว่า[b]''แสง''[/b]สินะ แสงคือธีมหลักอย่างที่บอกมันช่วยทำอะไรๆให้ง่ายขึ้น ยิงมอนฯดาเมจแรงขึ้น(อารมณ์ประมาณ Alan Wake แต่เกมนี้มาก่อนอีกนะ 555) เกมนี้เน้น Puzzle ใช้หัวสมองเป็นหลักถึงเกมมันจะดูง่ายๆแต่เชื่อเถอะครับมันไม่ง่ายขนาดนั้นอาจจะเพราะมุมกล้องด้วยแหละที่ทำให้บางทีต้องเดินวนเป็นไก่ตาแตก พยายามสังเกตและตีความดูครับ

31402688.review:
What can I say about obscure? It's like silent hill without the imagination. While horror games often have clunky combat and odd controls Obscure is missing the character that other survival horrors possess. The level design is really basic and repetitive. While Leafmore High is a realistic depiction of a school it doesn't make a good video game map. The AI behaviour is laughable, the voice acting is dire and the story is ok at best. 

Despite all this, I enjoyed my time playing Obscure. It has enough unique ideas that it may surprise you once or twice and never pretends to be anything other then a horror cliche. If you're tired of the first person stealth gameplay that modern horror games provide you might just enjoy Obscure. Though I'd recommend Resident Evil first.

31379835.review:
Personally i love this game. It takes me back to when i was a kid playing the original resident evil. Silly horror tropes, terrible voice acting, effective jump scares, asinine puzzle solving. Its all there. Only they got rid of the tank controls everyone hates. Is the story "good"? Not really. But its serviceable. Is the gameplay "good"? Not really.But its serviceable.  But you dont play old school horror games for either of those. Its about execution of atmosphere, which this game nails. Fully recommend if 90's horror is a thing you enjoy. 

If it isnt, this may not be for you. Everything is archaic at this point in time, considering how old the game is, the combat is as simple as it gets, and the puzzles are the basic "find the key for this door by solving this puzzle that has something to do with that random note you found and probably didnt pay attention to". These are actually the charms of these types of games, but they arent for everyone. 

Subjectively, i'd give this game an 8/10 Objectively, it'd get something around a 4/10. Theres a huge disparity between what a general modern gamer is looking for, and what specific kinds of people like. So if anything i've said sounds attractive to you, go for it and get both obscure games. You'll enjoy yourself. If your standards for gaming are a modern day triple A blockbuster, stay far, far away.

31050986.review:
The graphics are obviously dated now, and it takes a few minutes to "get into" the game, especially the combat, but once you've acclimated it gels quite nicely. It's more or less a 3rd person "survival" game. You're scavenging, fighting and solving puzzles. Light is your friend. The game has a linear progression path, but the gameworld itself is mostly open, once you have found the respective keys. You can choose between 4 (later 5) characters, whereby you're always moving as a duo and you can also freely switch between the 2 you take with you. In theory every character has a special ability that make the game easier, practically you can just play as whoever you want. I stuck with my main character and the hot chick and had no problems. The AI companion is mostly useless anyway and at the very end even a burden, so I would not take one to the final boss, unless you want them to die and yes, there is perma death in this game. Every character can die. Luckily you can just load an older save to avert virtual perma death. Saving is done ONLY manually via CDs found in the game, so there is a limited number of saves you can have, but in the end I had over 10 saves left, so shouldn't be too much of a problem. Just remember that the game NEVER auto saves.

The atmosphere is pretty good, still. Voice acting and story acting in general are terrible though. Well, it's a pretty old game after all. I also forgot how short it was. You can complete it easily in 4-5 hours. Buy during a deep sale. Worked flawlessly under Win 10 for me.

30129996.review:
2004 / Hydravision

Obscure es un survival del 2004, con el apogeo de la ps2, cuando salían un montón de survivals de cámaras fijas y vista en tercera persona, camino que empezo resident evil unos años antes.
Obscure toma ese estilo de juego para darnos un survival de vieja escuela, de esos de discos limitados para guardar, botiquines y armas escasos, y algun que otro puzzle para estancarnos unos minutillos.....

Pues no, eso se supone que es lo que será en niveles altos, pero los desarrolladores quisieron que primero habría que pasarse el juego en normal, donde los botiquines, discos de salvado y munición no falta, perdiendo todo el sentido de "survival", herencia por supuesto, de donde proviene, ya que es un port de ps2.

El juego intenta parecerse a los resident pero no lo consigue, quedando muy por debajo de ellos. Graficamente ha envejecido bastante mal, aunque supongo que en esos tiempos tampoco era muy diferente a lo que había por su época, ahora cantan más que la traviata. La jugabilidad pues del estilo de los survivals de antaño, cámaras fijas por las que intuyes que tienes a un enemigo delante pero que no ves sino avanzas, y físicas de movimiento bastante cutres (¿como me puede bloquear el paso como si fuera un muro un bicho del tamaño de un perro pequeño?)

La ambientación y los sonidos estan muy logrados pero para mi gusto pierden su efectividad debido al abuso de ellos, al principio te los crees, gritos o gemidos, armarios que se mueven.. pero cuando te los repiten una y otra vez en cada sala ya no asustan, sino agotan, más de lo mismo con la música, muy lograda pero que puede llegar a taladrarte los oidos después de estar escuchándo una y otra vez las dos sintonías que tiene.

La historia es plana y de serie B, recordando a esas peliculas de universitarios y monstruos (the faculty) con personajes jovenes estereotipados y facilmente prescindibles con habilidades especiales que para mi gusto, desde algunas inútlies hasta otras que rompen el juego (¿como puede haber un individuo que te diga si te has dejado algo en alguna sala? y la exploración y el survival donde están?) aunque bueno, para su favor hay que decir que esta todo muy a la vista, dejarte algo es bastante dificil.

Y direis, pues vaya mierda de título y os digo... no, tampoco es eso, es normalillo, de lo que se destilaba antaño, resultón, corto, muy corto y sencillo. Digamos que es un juego de serie B dentro de este tipo de juegos algo, que pensándolo de otra manera, casi hasta que le viene como anillo al dedo.
Y es una pena, porque en una segunda vuelta, en nivel especial, podría ser mucho más interesante y disfrutable pero.. es que no contiene ningun aliciente para repetirlo sino es para ver a una de las protagonistas con otro trajecito, o utilizar el super arma desbloqueada de turno.

Recomendable para los nostálgicos de aquella época o los completistas de este tipo de juegos, pero poco más,  hay mucha más calidad en el mercado que obscure.

6 / 10

29890268.review:
Great game! The dialogue is a little cheesy sometimes, but it makes up for it with some pretty good gameplay (which obviously matters more than the dialogue), and a great atmosphere. 
The characters' special abilities really help (in my opinion Josh was the most helpful, because he could inform you if you left something behind in a room, like a weapon you may have missed).
I think one of the only actual gameplay difficulties would be that you can't change the camera angle. It doesn't really bother me, but I had a few friends who said they they wished you could move the angle around as you please.

This game sort of reminds of the fictional game 'Stay Alive" from the movie called 'Stay Alive', which was the whole reason I bought it for ps2 awhile back. Co-op is pretty cool. I was pretty sad to find out that there was no online co-op, but local was fun, and it made the whole thing a lot easier to tackle with more than one person.

It's not incredibly difficult. Like, it can be challenging if you're playing on hard mode, but I don't think there's ever been a time where I was stuck on something for hours. I don't really see a problem with this, because unlike some, I hate having to restart levels over and over because of a tough opponent, but I can see why some people wouldn't like it.

All in all, I think Obcure is a pretty great survival horror, and if you're a fan of the original Silent Hill or Resident Evil games, chances are, you'll probably find this pretty interesting.

10/10 will definitely play again <3

28091963.review:
ObsCure was one of the last games I played on the original Xbox before I finally sold the console. I thoroughly enjoyed it then, and was looking forward to seeing if it had the same charm years later. It does.

If you're a fan of the original Resident Evil, you'll undoubtedly enjoy this. It has the same fixed-camera angles, a spooky setting (a school as opposed to a mansion), inventory juggling (although thankfully no storage boxes), and the same general feel. Some call it a rip-off, but it's more than that. The differences are significant enough to warrant a purchase for survival horror aficionados.

The setting is appropriately creepy, as you explore the school grounds after hours and at night. The mutated monsters are horrific, but not "scary," per se. The cast includes five playable students with various minor differences in terms of skills; even if one or more dies, you can continue with the remaining one(s). The music is a particular standout, adding a lot to the overall menace. Acquiring new weapons throughout the game ensures you'll be prepared to combat the horrors within Leafmore High.

Some general tips for aspiring students are in order. A controller is absolutely necessary; trying to play with the keyboard would be horrible. (I shake my head at elitist PC users who scoff at controllers.) Character Josh has the ability to determine if any items of interest are still in the area, something I found to be valuable. On Easy mode, using a teammate (either another player or the AI) is helpful and adds to the fun. However, if you opt to play Hard mode (unlocked after beating Easy), AI teammates will use up your ammo quickly. Easy is fun and fairly challenging, but Hard definitely lives up to its name with limited supplies and fewer save disks. Hard is the more satisfying experience, but it can take quite a while (and reloading) to devise the best strategies, including avoiding monsters and not exploring every single room/area.

After completing ObsCure 100% on Steam, I'm going to take a break from survival horror for a bit until I go into uncharted territory with the sequel. I'm hoping for a similar fun experience.

По сути - сурвайвал хоррор уровня чуть ниже среднего. С примитивной боевкой (как, в принципе, почти у всех игр жанра на то время), примитивным дизайном монстров, очень поверхностными головоломками и сюжетом. Праздником креатива тут, прямо скажем, не пахнет.

И я наслаждался каждой божьей секундой этой игры.

Мы сели проходить это счастье вдвоем, потом подтянулся еще народ и в итоге все это мероприятие переросло в ночь стеба и угара, благо игра дает повод для этого. Играли связкой Джош+Шэнон. Джош обладает единственной полезной уникальной абилкой во всей игре (сканирует комнаты на предмет айтемов), а у Шенон эта самая уникальная абилка - самая уморительная фигня во вселенной. Ее способность - выдавать подсказки к прохождению, но поскольку все пазлы элементарные - все выливается в то, что она отчаянно и очень смешно капитанит. На кнопку, тригеррящую капитанство давил буквально в каждой комнате, и фактически в каждой комнате она дарила нам какую-нибудь очередную великую цитату.

Короче говоря, в коопе оно играется очень весело. Возможно это и не заслуга игры вовсе, просто так звезды встали, черт его знает.

В общем и целом, к этой игре в минимальные системные требования надо вписать минимум одного другана рядом, второй контроллер и пиво.

25439453.review:
[b]If you've ever played a survival-horror game, you've seen all of this stuff before. The only addition to the mix is the Leafdale High School setting and a cast of five teen protagonists who are grungy versions of the kids from The OC. Hydravision has designed Obscure as a veritable reproduction of the Resident Evil series, including a "greatest hits" package of story, atmosphere, and even architecture (hmm, we've seen that double-staircase foyer before). The story, however, is more of a ripoff of Robert Rodriguez's 1998 high-school horror flick, The Faculty, with tentacled monstrosities reminiscent of H.P. Lovecraft's nightmarish creations and mutated human zombies replacing the movie's aliens.

At any rate, these creatures smash through walls and doors just like similar beasties did way back when. Gameplay is structured around scrounging through rooms for items that can be combined into tools and weapons, collecting keys, pushing bookshelves, and saving progress with collectible CDs (space-age technology compared to Resident Evil's typewriter ribbons). You can reach the ending in six or seven hours, depending on your survival-horror experience. That experience really comes in handy, too, as some situations here precisely mimic those found in earlier Capcom games. A room with a missing lever and sliding shelves is a near-perfect copy of a chamber that puzzled Leon S. Kennedy in Resident Evil 2. Well, at least Hydravision seems to have done its homework.

A few interesting concepts liven up the same old, same old. Light is a weapon almost as potent as pistols and aluminum baseball bats. Turn a flashlight on high-beam or smash away boards covering windows and you can drive back or even kill creatures. Duct tape a flashlight to a pistol and you've got a great one-two punch for dealing with many of the game's nasties.

Also, you work in a two-person team for the most part, and can give orders to your buddy, switch between the duo on the fly, or head back to a gathering area to pick and choose a pair from all five members of your group. This sometimes comes in handy, as you need to team up to kill many monsters, and each kid in the Scooby Gang has a special attribute. Josh, for instance, is an investigative reporter with the school paper, so he can sniff out clues and let you know if there's anything else to be done in a room or hallway. Stan is tops at forcing locks, making him a wise choice when it comes to breaking into a room. Kenny can run and punch like the varsity athlete that he is. Smart Shannon provides tips on current puzzles. And Ashley can rapid-fire a pistol.

None of these abilities is generally needed, though. Sure, Stan is more efficient at breaking locks than Josh, but the latter can still get the job done given an extra few seconds. Shannon's skill more or less duplicates that of Josh, and since the game isn't going to hurt your brain anyways, you don't need their tips to solve puzzles. Only Kenny and Ashley are truly useful, because of their fighting talents. And even those two aren't indispensable, since--just like in all good teen horror movies--anyone can die at any time, and you can complete the game even if some of your pals bite the dust.

At times, you'll be tempted to thin out the ranks yourself. Each member of the gang is an irritating teen stereotype. Kenny's the jock. Josh's the adventurous nerd who always gets the girl in John Hughes movies. Ashley's the pretty, snotty cheerleader. Shannon's the bookish one who nobody notices is really sexy. Stan's the stoner, who calls everyone "dawg" and describes things he doesn't like as "whack." After a couple of hours of listening to this crew, you'll find yourself rooting for the monsters.

Co-op play is a great idea poorly realized. There is no LAN or Net support, so players have to play side by side on the same machine. Gamepads are supported, but not mice, an omission that leaves one player stuck with the clunky yet serviceable keyboard. And the camera sticks with the lead player at all times, forcing the second player to trail closely behind or get lost. Co-op play betrays Obscure's PlayStation 2 and Xbox origins. Clearly, the mode of play has just been tossed into the PC version with no real concern for how to properly enjoy it on that platform.

More care has been taken with the translation from console to PC where visuals are concerned. For a console port, this is a great-looking game. Leafdale may look more like a run-down hospital or mental asylum than a functioning high school, but it serves its spooky purposes nicely. Much of the furniture and assorted rubbish can be moved, too, so you're not adventuring in front of static 2D backdrops. Animations are very well done, particularly when characters are swinging baseball bats or metal pipes in fight sequences. Moving shadows add eerie possibilities to every corridor, giving you the impression that something's always about to leap from a nearby door or locker. The tense atmosphere is further enhanced with distant roars, banging noises that can't be explained, and a hair-raising music soundtrack that features Latin chanting and a title track by Sum 41 (not nearly as scary, unless you're creeped out by boy-band metal).

In the end, Obscure lives up to its name. It's competent enough as far as blatant ripoffs of the great-granddaddy of survival horror go, but so much has been cobbled together that the game has no distinct identity of its own.[/b]

25414472.review: "Obscure" is a surprisingly good survival horror game in the vein of "Resident Evil 1-2". It is set in a college setting (a la "Faculty" or "Suspiria"). You find and use objects, solve puzzles and battle monsters, just like in other games of the genre. There are mutliple characters, each with a particular skill and you're free to switch between them almost anytime (you can still finish the game if you lose a couple of main characters). An interesting feature is that you can have a human or AI-controlled sidekick (tha AI is quite good, it didn't cause me problems, unlike Daikatana and many other gaems). The story isn't groundbreaking, but not too bad and has some twists. The levels are varied and well-designed, you feel like you're actually exploring a monster-ridden high school. The monsters aren't too frightening or ineresting, however, except perhaps the final boss. The game is a little short (5-6 hours to finish on Normal), but an enjoyable and satisfying experience. It even has some cool extras (making of videos, new costumes and weapons after the first walkthrough, unlockable soundtrack etc.). Recommended.

23569673.review:
El estudio francés de desarrollo Hydravision entertainment se inició en el mundo videojueguil con este muy decente Survival Horror cooperativo.
Obscure es un juego de terror en el que su mayor atractivo es su propuesta cooperativa y sus protegonistas adolescentes. Un videojuego que recoge el terror de esas películas como Scream y  Sé lo que hicisteis el último verano que tanto estuvieron de moda, y lo traslada al mundo de los videojuegos.
Es un juego corto, con una historia sencilla, pero bien hilada y satisfactoria. Unos personajes bien diferenciados, que cumplen los clichés de los adolescentes típicos estadounidenses de dinero.

En lo jugable no tiene demasiada profundidad. Puedes recorrer con más o menos libertad un instituto con sus diferentes áreas, combatiendo muchos enemigos y desvelando poco a poco la oscura trama y saber quiénes son los malos que desencadenan todo el horror en el centro. El cooperativo no está bien aprovechado, y aunque cada personaje tiene sus propias habilidades, puedes completar el juego sin tener que manejarlos a todos, ya que sus habilidades especiales son muy prescindibles y poco útiles en la mayoría de situaciones. Algunos puzzles interesantes bien construidos, escenarios lúgubres, variedad de enemigos, un empleo de la luz para combatir los enemigos muy influenciado de Alone in the Dark: the new nightmare  y unos personajes que no caen demasiado bien y a los que no preocupa mucho si sobreviven o no, aunque es recomendable finalizar la aventura intentando conseguir que todos los personajes lleguen vivos.

También destaca el tono desenfadado de la aventura a pesar de tratarse de un título de terror. Una BSO de cánticos eclesiásticos muy poco acorde con el tono del juego, que desentona profundamente, unas mecánicas de combate que se pueden mejorar y unos personajes no suficientemente trabajados.

Aún así es un juego muy divertido, que engancha y que con su historia de ciencia ficción acerca de especies vegetales con extrañas y peligrosas mutaciones, entretiene, te mete algún susto y te puede hacer reír a partes iguales. 7'7

23474181.review:
(Resumo do Game)


Obscure


PCXBOXPS2


06 Abr, 2005 



Desenvolvedora:Hydravision Entertainment


Distribuidora:DreamCatcher Interactive


Gêneros:Aventura / Horror


ESRB:Adultos 17 +

A história de ObsCure se passa no Colégio Leafmore, que é dirigido pelo diretor Herbert Friedman. Um dia, um aluno chamado Kenny, decide ficar até mais tarde na escola jogando basquete, quando percebe que sua mochila fora roubada. Ao tentar perseguir quem roubou, acaba chegando em um misterioso porão, e em uma estranha sala, encontra um aluno chamado Dan, em um estado muito estranho. Ao tentar sair do porão, estranhas criaturas aparecem e matam Dan. Kenny tenta fugir, mas alguém acaba fechando o alçapão do porão, deixando ele trancado lá com várias criaturas bizarras. No dia seguinte, sua irmã Shannon e sua namorada Ashley, sentem pela falta de Kenny, e concluem que ele desapareceu na escola. Então se reúnem com Josh para lhe achar, e acabam ficando trancados na escola em um sábado, mas eles não podiam saber que muitas coisas iriam acontecer. Pouco mais tarde, encontram Stan na escola, e ele se reúne ao grupo. Eles descobrem que os bichos que aparecem na escola podem ser detidos pela luz, por isso o uso de uma lanterna é indispensável, além de poder quebrar as janelas quando possível, ao passar do tempo, pistas vão aparecendo, e cabe ao jogador desvendá-las, a história se baseia em alguns energéticos que o diretor havia testado em alguns alunos, como Dan, por exemplo. ObsCure é um survival-horror com um enredo inusitado, já que a história começa quando um grupo de jovens encontra uma planta misteriosa no campus da universidade que estudam e o vegetal se mostra hospedeiro de uma miríade de bichos infernais, liberando sobre a instituição de ensino horror e medo. ObsCure exige a cooperação constante entre o jogador e seu aliado, que pode ser controlado pelo computador ou administrado por outro jogador que pode assumí-lo a qualquer momento da partida, sendo assim um jogo "Multiplayer". Existem seis personagens no total que serão revezados durante o jogo, onde cada um deles possui habilidades distintas e armas suficientes para destruir as estranhas criaturas. O jogador assume o papel de um dos universitários e deve lutar pela sua vida enquanto tenta solucionar o mistério.

A novidade é que sua meta não é salvar apenas a própria pele, mas também outros quatro estudantes em segurança, mas com um detalhe: você pode usar um deles como "sacrifício" para ajudar a salvar os demais.

22915026.review:
Obscure - игра в жанре survival horror, выпущенная в 2004 году компанией Hydravision, для консолей шестого поколения и годом позже для ПК.

В высшей школе Лимфор, на протяжении нескольких десятилетий бесследно пропадают ученики. Сюжет повествует нам о пяти американских подростках, которые после пропажи одного из друзей на территории школы, пытаются его отыскать, начав собственное расследование. В дальнейшем главные герои выясняют, куда и при каких обстоятельствах попадают невинные люди и какие ужасные эксперементы проводят над ними, в подземных катакомбах под школой.

Геймплей игры представляет из себя хоррор на выживание. Игра во многом схожа с сериями таких знаменитых игр как: Silent Hill и Resident Evil. Некоторые элементы позаимствованы именно оттуда. Нам дадут возможность поиграть за всех пятерых персонажей, однако управлять можно лишь двумя, переключаясь между ними в любой момент. Пока вы управляете одним игроком, второй находится под управлением игровой системы.

У каждого из персонажей есть свои определённые навыки. В зависимости от ситуации и текущих задач, вам понадобятся те или инные способности героев. Схема уровней построенна таким образом, что вы всегда можете вернуться к точке сбора и сменить персонажей на других. В случае смерти одного из героев, игра не закончится, но играть уже прийдется без него.

Боевая система изначально зародившаяся для консолей, перекочевала в упрощённом виде на ПК. Поскольку управление сосредоточено только на клавиатуре, то эффект прицеливания происходит автоматически, при нажатии соответствующей кнопки. В ближнем бою всё несколько сложней. Каждая схватка не обойдется без потерь вашего здоровья. Так как некоторые атаки врагов невозможно отразить, либо увернутся от них. 

Помимо нескольких видов оружий ближнего боя, пистолетов и дробовиков, в игре есть другое, крайне важное оружие. Это свет, будь то естественный(солнце) или механический(фонарики, лазеры). Именно уязвимости к свету подвержены все монстры и тьма, окружающая их. Разбив окно в комнате, можно сразу же убить нескольких тварей, а при использования фонариков, направленных на нечисть, можно значительно их ослабить, убив намного быстрее. Однако фонарики ещё необходимо найти, а при долгом использовании они перегреваются, что не даёт вам постоянного преимущества.

В игре есть несложные элементы взаимодействия между предметами. К примеру, можно нацепить фонарик к оружию, с помощью найденной изоленты. Или взяв проволоку, попробовать взломать замок. В целом, ничего существенного.

Одним из плюсом игры считаю её сложность. Достаточно легко потерять одного из персонажей. Буквально после нескольких ударов, игрок умирает, если его не подлечить. Некоторые сильные монстры, способны убивать мгновенно, окажись вы, на достаточно близком к ним растоянии. Медикаменты, коими являются аптечки первой помощи и волшебный восстанавливающий напиток в банке из автоматов, встречаются не так часто. А сохранять игру можно лишь в том случае, если у вас в инвентаре, имееются диски записи, которые попадаются в дозированом кол-ве.

Другим положительным качеством, считаю кинематографичность. Игра полна роликов и видео-вставок, которые максимально приблеженны по качеству к картинке в самой игре, что делает восприятие подачи одним целым. Управление производится без участия мышки, мы не способны сами менять угол обзора. Но в игре присутствует динамическая камера, постоянно меняющая ракурсы, в зависимости от вашего месторасположения. Всё это выглядит очень зрелищно, и как ни странно для такой системы, даже удобно.

В игре просто отвратительное управление. Неудобный интерфейс инвентаря, благодаря которому, нельзя нормально делать такие вещи, как смена оружия во время боя или выбор аптечки, что часто приводит к вашей смерти.

Игра очень атмосферная. Мрачные уровни, страшные монстры, довольно высока уязвимость, недостаток медикаментов, сохранений и боеприпасов, заставляют вас играть предельно аккуратно и быть максимально сосредоточеным, ведь за каждым углом можно встретить нового мутанта.

[h1] Атмосферная, с интересным сюжетом, увелекательным геймплеем игра, которая однозначно достойна вашего внимания, в особенности это касается любителей хорроров с элементами выживания.

Оценка: 9/10 [/h1]

22701672.review:
Obscure is like a B horror movie, with all it's downsides and advantages, only that it's a game.

The advantage a good B movie has is the ability to turn something really dumb and forced into an enjoyable experience. Obscure is doing this 100%, the plot isn't there to tell a story, the plot is there to force characters into situations where they must fight monsters. By the way, the characters are basic high-school teens and they have zero character outside the stereotypes you can see in any american show/movie whatever which features high school life. Hell, they don't even talk to each other outside the usual "WE WERE WORRYING ABOUT U GUYZ" or some shit. 
About the monsters, it's dumb, the concept of them being vulnerable to light is good, but the game has no explanation WHY ON EARTH ARE THEY VULNERABLE. Since the monsters (it's not a major spoiler, but it's a detail which isn't obvious, you decide) [spoiler] aren't "shadow" creatures, they are mutated persons for fuck's sake. Why mutation causes them to hate light? Whatever	[/spoiler].
So now that we have the grasp of what kinda feel Obscure has when you think about it, we can move on to how it feels when you don't. Just like a B movie should feel, you can laugh on the logic bumps and "weird" execution or cringe on them. Mainly I was laughing, the whole game just screams "don't take me seriously pls". 

Outside of that the gameplay was actually fine. The fighting could be a little bit more complicated, outside of the final boss you're just lighting and shooting at random creatures. The best mechanic is that the game has perma death, if one of the five characters die it's not game over, the character just dies, no coming back, it adds to the feel that people usually DIE in horror themed stuff. There's also a part where you can basically kill one of your teammates by being an inattentive prick like me, that was super cool, I felt bad after that. 
Also, you can combine items. Maybe back then it was a huge thing (I don't think so) that you can combine items, but I feel like that's not a big deal, not that big at least as people emphasize that. Your options are limited as hell, no reason to pee your knickers just because you can tape a flashlight to a handgun or a shotgun. You can also play co-op, but I didn't really care about that, I like my horror alone. But if you want to pop a beer and laugh while you're participating in some B horror action then Obscure is probably one of the best games for that.

I shouldn't like this, but I had fun while playing so I don't care.

Et bien ma foi, il est plutôt bien réussi ce jeu !

Pour résumer l'histoire, vous êtes une bande de jeunes ayant chacun des caractéristiques particulières et complémentaires, placée dans le Collège de Leafmore. Par la suite vous découvrez peu à peu que des créatures étranges rôdent, et que des élèves viennent à disparaître. Votre mission si vous l'acceptez : découvrir ce qui se trame dans ce bahut, au péril de vos vies.
Je ne l'ai pas encore terminé mais après avoir enchaîné plusieurs chapitres, voici ce qu'on peut - à mon sens - en retenir.

Points forts :
Une bonne recréation d'un univers scolaire avec notamment des salles de classe, une bibliothèque, un réfectoire, un dortoir, etc. En matière de bestiaire, les ennemis se veulent effrayants, avec des apparences diverses. On retient également l'ambiance, qui de manière générale est glauque et énigmatique. 
Enfin, on peut évoquer les diverses énigmes qui amènent le ou les joueurs à réfléchir tout en alternant avec des phases de combat.

Points négatifs :
La caméra en solo n'est pas des plus agréable, mais en mode coopération, préparez-vous à l'apocalypse. En effet, les plans choisis sont dans un genre Resident Evil, avec des sortes de caméras relativement  fixes. Donc si vous jouez à 2, il arrivera fréquemment qu'un joueur soit trop en avance ou en retard et vous allez vous battre pour le contrôle.

En fin de compte, un bon jeu du type Survival  Horror jouable à deux.

EDIT: le mot masqué par Steam est le suivant : 'ret*rd'. J'ai pourtant précisé dans les options que la critique était en français, mais bon...

La jugabilidad es como la de los Resident Evil antiguos, planos estáticos y cámara firme que consigue mantenerte siempre en tension porque no sabes lo que hay ni lo que puede pasar detras de la cámara.
